cases.title: Wine & Spirits
cases.challenge: Customers search by grape, region, occasion, food pairing, price point—often all at once. Traditional search chokes on 'dry red under 30 for steak dinner'.
cases.solution: XTAL parses varietal, style, price, and pairing intent. Returns Cabernets, Malbecs, and Syrahs sorted by value and food compatibility.
exampleQueries: crisp white wine for seafood under 25
bold red gift for wine snob
champagne alternatives for NYE
Willamette Valley pinot noir 2019 or 2020
benefits: Better product discovery increases basket size
Customers find what they want faster

cases.title: Auto Parts & Accessories
cases.challenge: Mix of exact part number lookups ('OEM-7R3Z-19G490-A') and intent-based browsing ('floor mats for 2019 F-150 crew cab'). Traditional search can't handle both.
cases.solution: Full-Spectrum Search routes part numbers to precision matching while parsing year/make/model/trim from natural language queries.
exampleQueries: OEM-7R3Z-19G490-A
floor mats 2019 F-150 crew cab weatherproof
brake pads for daily driver Civic
something to stop squeaky belt
benefits: Less support burden from search failures

cases.title: Craft & Hobby Supplies
cases.challenge: Customers describe projects, not products. 'Stuff to make friendship bracelets' should return thread, beads, clasps, patterns—not a single SKU.
cases.solution: XTAL understands project-based intent and can return curated product sets, related items, and appropriate skill-level matches.
exampleQueries: beginner knitting kit for 10 year old
watercolor supplies for plein air painting
fabric for mid-century modern throw pillows
everything I need for resin coasters
benefits: More items per order through better discovery
Customers find what they need without endless browsing

cases.title: Outdoor & Sporting Goods
cases.challenge: Searches combine activity, conditions, experience level, and brand preferences. 'Warm sleeping bag for winter backpacking not too heavy' has five constraints.
cases.solution: XTAL extracts temperature rating, weight class, activity type, and experience level—returns ranked results without requiring filter gymnastics.
exampleQueries: ultralight tent for AT thru-hike
warm sleeping bag 20 degree under 3 lbs
beginner fly fishing setup under 200
rain jacket that doesn't sound like a trash bag
benefits: Less reliance on complex filter navigation

cases.title: Health & Supplements
cases.challenge: Customers search by symptom, ingredient, dietary restriction, and goal—not product name. 'Vegan omega-3 for joint health' needs semantic understanding.
cases.solution: XTAL maps symptoms to ingredients, respects dietary filters, and surfaces relevant products without requiring medical-grade tagging.
exampleQueries: vegan omega 3 for joint pain
natural sleep aid non-habit forming
protein powder keto friendly no artificial sweeteners
prenatal vitamin with folate not folic acid

cases.title: Industrial & B2B Supply
cases.challenge: Repeat buyers punching part numbers alongside new customers browsing by application. One search bar needs to serve the procurement manager and the first-time buyer.
cases.solution: Full-Spectrum Search handles MPN/SKU precision for reorders while parsing application-based queries for new customer acquisition.
exampleQueries: cut resistant gloves level A4 food safe
replacement motor for Dayton 1LPL4
something to clean grease off concrete floor
benefits: Fast reorder experience for repeat buyers
Better search-to-quote conversion for new customers

sections.headline: Moving from another search provider?
sections.description: We make migration painless. Here's how XTAL compares to what you're using now.

comparisons.details: Built-in search is fine for 20 products. At scale, it's costing you sales. XTAL installs in minutes and the difference is immediate.
Algolia is excellent if you have engineering resources to configure it. XTAL gives you comparable results out of the box. Plain-English merchandising instead of JSON rule configs.
Searchspring bolted on ML features to a traditional search stack. XTAL was built from the ground up around LLM understanding. The difference shows in edge cases.
Klevu's AI features require significant training data and tuning. XTAL works with your catalog as-is, understanding queries from day one.

sections.headline: The searches that break traditional engines
sections.intro: These are actual queries from real e-commerce stores. See how XTAL handles what keyword search can't.

examples.query: anniversary gift for wife who has everything

traditional.result: No results for 'anniversary gift wife everything'

xtal.reasoning: Identified: Gift occasion (Anniversary) + Recipient (Spouse/Wife) + Constraint (Unique/Experiential preferred)
xtal.result: Personalized items, experience gifts, luxury accessories, artisan pieces

examples.query: my back hurts from my office chair

traditional.result: Results for 'back office chair' — showing office chairs

xtal.reasoning: Identified: Problem (Back pain) + Context (Office/Seated work) + Need (Ergonomic support)
xtal.result: Lumbar cushions, ergonomic seat pads, posture correctors, standing desk converters

examples.query: running shoes wide feet flat arches under 150

traditional.result: Results for 'running shoes' — 200+ items, user must filter manually

xtal.reasoning: Identified: Category (Running shoes) + Width (Wide) + Arch (Low/Flat support) + Price (<$150)
xtal.result: Stability shoes in wide widths with motion control, sorted by value

traditional.result: Exact SKU match only, misses compatibles

xtal.reasoning: Identified: Brand (DeWalt) + Spec (20V 5Ah 2-pack) + Flexibility (Compatible alternatives OK)
xtal.result: OEM DeWalt 2-pack + compatible aftermarket options, sorted by rating

faqSchema.question: What types of e-commerce stores does XTAL Search work with?
faqSchema.answer: XTAL works with any e-commerce platform including Shopify, Shopify Plus, BigCommerce, WooCommerce, Magento, and custom headless builds. It's particularly effective for specialty retailers with complex catalogs, growing DTC brands, and B2B wholesalers.

faqSchema.question: How is XTAL different from Algolia or Searchspring?
faqSchema.answer: XTAL was built from the ground up around LLM understanding, not as an add-on to traditional keyword search. This means it works out of the box without extensive configuration, handles natural language queries natively, and uses plain English for merchandising rules instead of JSON configs.

faqSchema.question: What is Full-Spectrum Search?
faqSchema.answer: Full-Spectrum Search is XTAL's hybrid approach that combines vector/semantic search with precision keyword matching. This means it handles exact SKU lookups and vague intent queries equally well—in the same search bar, automatically.

faqSchema.question: How long does it take to set up XTAL Search?
faqSchema.answer: For standard Shopify and BigCommerce integrations, setup takes same-day. More complex integrations with custom platforms typically take 1-2 days. No engineering resources required on your end.

faqSchema.question: Do I need to tag or enrich my product data for XTAL to work?
faqSchema.answer: No. XTAL works with your existing product data as-is. The LLM understands your catalog structure automatically and doesn't require custom attributes or AI training.
